text: Muniza! Oh my word, I only just saw this message :face_with_rolling_eyes: I'm so sorry I didn't see you! How was the studio tour?

Ah that's okay! I should have let known earlier aha
I was trying to look for you whilst we were going through all the floors but I don't think I saw you aha

It went well! We gathering information about the company history, ethos and projects that they've worked on for a brief/presentation at uni :D we'll be presenting what we found out about the studio next Tuesday
We spoke to Will Cook and Matt and they were super lovely and went into alot of detail
Will Cook is an alumni from my Uni so he likes to refer to us as his favourite students aha :sweat_smile: :laughing:
I wanted to confirm, at Blue Zoo, are the working hours between 10am to 6pm? :O

It's okay :wink: I actually work on the same project as Will, he's my animation supervisor on Paddington. Yeah our usual working hours are 10 to 6 here but we have the option of doing flexi-time too so sometimes I do 8:30 to 4:30 we can also do 10:30 to 6:30 for the latest.
oh wow! I didnt know that! It's really nice that they offer that there aha :smile:
Would you say that animation showreels should be rendered with nice lighting? also - would you say that branding is important when applying for jobs?
If you're applying for an animation role I don't think lighting is important. It would be better to spend time polishing the animation than faffing with lights. What kind of branding do you mean?

so on my course, they put a lot of emphasis towards having a nice brand for your showreel, website and business cards and making sure everything is consistent. for our animation submission, we need to make sure have a clear title card at the beginning and end and that the design for our title card matches our website and business cards
